actions.in_committee: House Committee on Interior and Insular Affairs

actions.text: Reported to House (Amended) by House Committee on Interior and Insular Affairs.  Report No: 97-819.
Called up by House on Call of Consent Calendar.
Received in the Senate and read twice and referred to the Committee on Indian Affairs.
Senate Committee on Indian Affairs discharged by Unanimous Consent.
Passed Senate without amendment by Voice Vote.

official_title: An act to provide for the use and distribution of funds to the Wyandot Tribe of Indians in docket 139 before the Indian Claims Commission and docket 141 before the United States Court of Claims, and for other purposes.

summary.text: Directs the Secretary of the Interior to divide funds, granted in specified judgments of the Indian Claims Commission and the U.S. Court of Claims, between the Wyandotte Tribe of Oklahoma and absentee Wyandotte descendants according to a specified formula. Provides for the distribution and use of the Wyandotte Tribe of Oklahoma's share of such funds.

titles.title: A bill to provide for the use and distribution of funds to the Wayndot Tribe of Indians in Docket 139 before the Indian Claims Commission and Docket 141 before the United States Court of Claims and for other purposes.

An act to provide for the use and distribution of funds to the Wyandot Tribe of Indians in docket 139 before the Indian Claims Commission and docket 141 before the United States Court of Claims, and for other purposes.
